titlestmt.titleproper: Social Science Research Council records, Abe Fellowships, Record Group 3, Series 8
A Guide to the Social Science Research Council records, Abe Fellowships, Record Group 3, Series 8 FA1871

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:58:57 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Social Science Research Council records, Abe Fellowships, Record Group 3, Series 8

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to the RAC from the Social Science Research Council as part of several different accessions between 2016 and 2017. These accessions were ingested as Accession 2016:003, 2016:005, 2016:009, 2016:010, 2016:074, 2016:075, 2017:017, 2017:018, 2017:024.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 8 of Record Group 3 consists of 6 subseries.
Subseries 8.2 Fellowship applicant declinations and withdrawals files, 1983-1994
Subseries 8.3 Fellowship applicant review general files, 1989-1992

Files documenting individual Abe Fellowship applicants were arranged into their own subseries with distinctions between files where applicants were awarded a fellowship and files where applicants were not reflected in subseries assignments. The fellowship files in Subseries 8.1 and 8.2 are ordered by the year of the fellowship award.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Abe Fellowship Program was a collaboration between the Social Science Research Council (SSRC) and the Japan Foundation Center for Global Partnership (CGP). Administered by the SSRC and the American Council of Learned Societies (ACLS), the Program awarded fellowships for multidisciplinary research on global issues and problem solving and strived to promote intellectual cooperation between Japan and the United States. The Program ran from 1991 to 2022.

Citizens from Japan and the United States could apply for the fellowship as well as scholars from other countries who demonstrated relationships to research communities in either nation. Applicants were required to have a Ph.D. or terminal degree.

During the early years of the program, fellowships concerned three research themes. These themes were: 1) Global issues; 2) Problems common amongst developed, industrialized countries; and 3) Issues relating to improving United States-Japan relations.

Later research themes included: 1) Threats to Personal, Societal, and International Security; 2) Growth and Sustainable Development; 3) Social, Scientific, and Cultural Trends and Transformations; and 4) Governance, Empowerment, and Participation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the files of the Social Science Research Council's (SSRC) Abe Fellowship Program. The Abe Fellowship Program was a collaboration between the SSRC and the Japan Foundation Center for Global Partnership (CGP). It was administered by the SSRC and the American Council of Learned Societies (ACLS). Fellowships were awarded to Japanese and United States citizens as well as scholars from other countries who demonstrated relationships to research communities in either nation. The fellowships were for multidisciplinary research on global issues and problem solving and were meant to promote intellectual cooperation between Japan and the United States.

This series is comprised of 6 subseries. Most of the series' contents document the Abe Fellowship Program Committee's review of fellowship applications. The first three subseries contain files devoted to the applicant review of several fellowship competitions. Subseries 1 contains files for applicants who were awarded a fellowship, and Subseries 2 contains files for applicants who were declined a fellowship or withdrew from competition. More general files pertaining to application review are contained in Subseries 3.

Smaller sets of records are contained in the other three subseries. Subseries 4 contains a run of chronology files for incoming and outgoing SSRC correspondence regarding the Abe Fellowship Program. Meeting files in Subseries 5 regard different meetings and conferences organized by the Program. Lastly, Subseries 6 contains files concerning the Program's budget and expense tracking.

Fellowship applications and other materials show the broad range of topics applicants and awarded fellows pursued in relation to the Program's research themes during these years of its operations. These themes were: 1) Global issues; 2) Problems common amongst developed, industrialized countries; 3) and Issues relating to improving United States-Japan relations.
Research subjects included:

- International security, peace keeping, conflict resolution; Japan's role in the United Nations in relation to these concerns; changes to international security in the post-Cold War Era; and various international conflicts
- International relations, specifically in relation to the Japan-United States relationship, Northeast Asia, and the Asia Pacific region; international aid; and international organizations
- International trade and economic relations; industries, management, and labor; and financial regulation
- Aging, elderly people, and retired workers; and demographic changes
- Perceptions and depictions of Japan and Japanese people outside of Japan
- The environment, natural resources, and climate change
- Culture, arts, media, and literature
- Immigration; people of Japanese heritage in countries outside of Japan; and other ethnic groups in Japan
- Other topics like education, women, religion, technology, politics, agriculture, and family studies

Numerous SSRC staff members were involved in the creation of these records including Helen Chauncey, Vanessa Vinarub, Jennifer Bourque, Mary Brynne McDonnell, Sheri Ranis, Minami Toshiyuki, Shiela Smith, Dee Warren, and Mary-Lea Cox.
Common material formats found throughout the collection, in addition to the aforementioned formats, include memos, drafts, notes, reports, meeting briefing books and agendas, invoices, and articles.

did.unittitle: Fellowship applicant awardee files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains Abe Fellowship Program Committee applicant files for applications awarded fellowships by the Committee. The files document the earliest competitions of the Social Science Research Council's (SSRC) Abe Fellowship Program. They span from 1991 to 1994.

There are no award letters included in the files. Research was done during the processing of the collection to verify what applicants were awarded through consulting the SSRC's Items newsletter archive. Some of these files include a small amount of correspondence that discusses the awardee's fellowship.

The files are chiefly comprised of the application materials which include the application forms, application checklists, project statements, letters of reference, and budget forms. Some files include additional correspondence.

Fellowship applicant declinations and withdrawals files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains Abe Fellowship Program Committee applicant files for applications declined fellowships by the Committee or were withdrawn by the applicants. The files document the earliest competitions of the Social Science Research Council's (SSRC) Abe Fellowship Program. They span from 1991 to 1995.

The files are chiefly comprised of letters from the Program declining the application and the application materials. The application materials include the application forms, application checklists, project statements, letters of reference, and budget forms. Some files include additional correspondence.

Fellowship applicant review general files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains files pertaining to the review of applications to the Social Science Research Council's Abe Fellowship Program that are not individual applicant files. These materials primarily originate from the 1991-1992 competition, the Program's first year awarding the fellowship.

The files document a preliminary round of review the Program conducted on fellowship applicants. These files include coversheets that describe if the Program selected the applicant to advance through the review round.
The subseries also includes miscellaneous applicant reference letters and application form templates.

did.unittitle: Abe Fellowship Program Committee Award 1991-1992 preliminary review – Cover sheets
Abe Fellowship Program Committee Award 1991-1992 – Miscellaneous applicant references
Abe Fellowship Program Committee Award 1991-1992 preliminary review – Cover sheets
Abe Fellowship Program envelopes - Application checklist forms
Chronology files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries holds the chronology files of the Social Science Research Council's (SSRC) Abe Fellowship Program. Chronology files contain correspondence for specific periods of time. The chronology files are divided between incoming and outgoing correspondence. Incoming correspondence is arranged alphabetically by the sender's name, and outgoing correspondence is arranged alphabetically by the addressee's name.

Correspondence in the files documents different administrative and program activities of the Abe Fellowship Program. The communications discuss Abe Fellowship Program Committee membership and meetings as well as SSRC staffing. There are also communications about applications to the Abe Fellowship Program, fellows' research projects, planning and preparation for Fellows' Conferences, and program reviews. Some files contain correspondence between the Abe Fellowship Program and the Japan Foundation Center for Global Partnership (CGP) which provides insights into the relationship between the two organizations.

Chronology file - 1994 outgoing correspondence
Meeting files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains files documenting the organization and activities of various Social Science Research Council (SSRC) Abe Fellowship Program meetings. These meetings are primarily Program Committee Meetings and Annual Abe Fellows' Conferences from between the start of the Program and the mid-1990s.

The subseries includes files devoted to supplemental materials for meetings such as Abe Fellowship proposal abstracts that were reviewed at Committee Meetings and workshop readings used at Fellows' Conferences. There are also files that concern Program reviews and reflections.
Common material formats found throughout the subseries include agendas, briefing books, drafts, articles, reports, memos, correspondence, meeting minutes, and notes.

Budget files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the Social Science Research Council (SSRC) Abe Fellowship Program's activities for monitoring expenses in relation to its grant funding, including grants from the Japan Foundation Center for Global Partnership (CGP). There are budget books for specific years of the Abe Fellowship Program's operations from between 1991 and 1994. There is also a budget book specific to the 1994 Abe Fellowship Program Fellows' Conference.
Material formats found within the subseries include invoices, payment requests, correspondence, and grant status summaries.
